other_tests.findings: Plasma cortisol level suppressed to less than 0.02 nmol per liter, reduced DHEA level from 15.0 to 1.6 nmol per liter, and reduced androstenedione level from 4.1 to 2.9 nmol per liter.
Plasma gonadotropin levels within normal prepubertal range at baseline and increased after administration.
DHEA levels increased during the test from 20.0 nmol per liter at baseline to 43.0 nmol per liter at 60 minutes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: DHEAS levels remained below the limit of detection throughout the test.

other_tests.date: Initial assessment at age 8, follow-up at age 12
other_tests.findings: At 8 years: DHEAS below detection limit, DHEA at upper limit of normal, androstenedione and testosterone about twice normal levels. At 12 years: DHEAS below detection limit, DHEA at upper limit, androstenedione and testosterone still twice the upper limits.
other_tests.changes_over_time: DHEAS levels at 12 years were 0.27 Î¼mol per liter during follow-up, indicating slight improvement.
